42
43/*
44 *
45 * The OpenType Font File: Data Types
46 */
47
48
49/* "The following data types are used in the OpenType font file.
50 * All OpenType fonts use Motorola-style byte ordering (Big Endian):" */
51
52/*
53 * Int types
54 */
55
56/* Integer types in big-endian order and no alignment requirement */
57template <typename Type,
58 unsigned int Size = sizeof (Type)>
59struct IntType
60{
61 typedef Type type;
62
63 IntType () = default;
64 explicit constexpr IntType (Type V) : v {V} {}
65 IntType& operator = (Type i) { v = i; return *this; }
66 /* For reason we define cast out operator for signed/unsigned, instead of Type, see:
67 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/pull/2875/commits/09836013995cab2b9f07577a179ad7b024130467 */
68 operator typename std::conditional<std::is_signed<Type>::value, signed, unsigned>::type () const { return v; }
69
70 bool operator == (const IntType &o) const { return (Type) v == (Type) o.v; }
71 bool operator != (const IntType &o) const { return !(*this == o); }
72
73 IntType& operator += (unsigned count) { *this = *this + count; return *this; }
74 IntType& operator -= (unsigned count) { *this = *this - count; return *this; }
75 IntType& operator ++ () { *this += 1; return *this; }
76 IntType& operator -- () { *this -= 1; return *this; }
77 IntType operator ++ (int) { IntType c (*this); ++*this; return c; }
78 IntType operator -- (int) { IntType c (*this); --*this; return c; }
79
80 HB_INTERNAL static int cmp (const IntType *a, const IntType *b)
81 { return b->cmp (*a); }
82 HB_INTERNAL static int cmp (const void *a, const void *b)
83 {
84 IntType *pa = (IntType *) a;
85 IntType *pb = (IntType *) b;
86
87 return pb->cmp (*pa);
88 }
89 template <typename Type2,
90 hb_enable_if (std::is_integral<Type2>::value &&
91 sizeof (Type2) < sizeof (int) &&
92 sizeof (Type) < sizeof (int))>
93 int cmp (Type2 a) const
94 {
95 Type b = v;
96 return (int) a - (int) b;
97 }
98 template <typename Type2,
99 hb_enable_if (hb_is_convertible (Type2, Type))>
100 int cmp (Type2 a) const
101 {
102 Type b = v;
103 return a < b ? -1 : a == b ? 0 : +1;
104 }
105 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
106 {
107 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
108 return_trace (c->check_struct (this));
109 }
110 protected:
111 BEInt<Type, Size> v;
112 public:
113 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (Size);
114};
115
116typedef IntType<uint8_t> HBUINT8; /* 8-bit unsigned integer. */
117typedef IntType<int8_t> HBINT8; /* 8-bit signed integer. */
118typedef IntType<uint16_t> HBUINT16; /* 16-bit unsigned integer. */
119typedef IntType<int16_t> HBINT16; /* 16-bit signed integer. */
120typedef IntType<uint32_t> HBUINT32; /* 32-bit unsigned integer. */
121typedef IntType<int32_t> HBINT32; /* 32-bit signed integer. */
122/* Note: we cannot defined a signed HBINT24 because there's no corresponding C type.
123 * Works for unsigned, but not signed, since we rely on compiler for sign-extension. */
124typedef IntType<uint32_t, 3> HBUINT24; /* 24-bit unsigned integer. */
125
126/* 15-bit unsigned number; top bit used for extension. */
127struct HBUINT15 : HBUINT16
128{
129 /* TODO Flesh out; actually mask top bit. */
130 HBUINT15& operator = (uint16_t i ) { HBUINT16::operator= (i); return *this; }
131 public:
132 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (2);
133};
134
135/* 16-bit signed integer (HBINT16) that describes a quantity in FUnits. */
136typedef HBINT16 FWORD;
137
138/* 32-bit signed integer (HBINT32) that describes a quantity in FUnits. */
139typedef HBINT32 FWORD32;
140
141/* 16-bit unsigned integer (HBUINT16) that describes a quantity in FUnits. */
142typedef HBUINT16 UFWORD;
143
144template <typename Type, unsigned fraction_bits>
145struct HBFixed : Type
146{
147 static constexpr float shift = (float) (1 << fraction_bits);
148 static_assert (Type::static_size * 8 > fraction_bits, "");
149
150 operator signed () const = delete;
151 operator unsigned () const = delete;
152 typename Type::type to_int () const { return Type::v; }
153 void set_int (typename Type::type i ) { Type::v = i; }
154 float to_float (float offset = 0) const { return ((int32_t) Type::v + offset) / shift; }
155 void set_float (float f) { Type::v = roundf (f * shift); }
156 public:
157 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (Type::static_size);
158};
159
160/* 16-bit signed fixed number with the low 14 bits of fraction (2.14). */
161using F2DOT14 = HBFixed<HBINT16, 14>;
162using F4DOT12 = HBFixed<HBINT16, 12>;
163using F6DOT10 = HBFixed<HBINT16, 10>;
164
165/* 32-bit signed fixed-point number (16.16). */
166using F16DOT16 = HBFixed<HBINT32, 16>;
167
168/* Date represented in number of seconds since 12:00 midnight, January 1,
169 * 1904. The value is represented as a signed 64-bit integer. */
170struct LONGDATETIME
171{
172 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
173 {
174 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
175 return_trace (c->check_struct (this));
176 }
177 protected:
178 HBINT32 major;
179 HBUINT32 minor;
180 public:
181 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (8);
182};
183
184/* Array of four uint8s (length = 32 bits) used to identify a script, language
185 * system, feature, or baseline */
186struct Tag : HBUINT32
187{
188 Tag& operator = (hb_tag_t i) { HBUINT32::operator= (i); return *this; }
189 /* What the char* converters return is NOT nul-terminated. Print using "%.4s" */
190 operator const char* () const { return reinterpret_cast<const char *> (this); }
191 operator char* () { return reinterpret_cast<char *> (this); }
192 public:
193 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (4);
194};
195
196/* Glyph index number, same as uint16 (length = 16 bits) */
197struct HBGlyphID16 : HBUINT16
198{
199 HBGlyphID16& operator = (uint16_t i) { HBUINT16::operator= (i); return *this; }
200};
201struct HBGlyphID24 : HBUINT24
202{
203 HBGlyphID24& operator = (uint32_t i) { HBUINT24::operator= (i); return *this; }
204};
205
206/* Script/language-system/feature index */
207struct Index : HBUINT16 {
208 static constexpr unsigned NOT_FOUND_INDEX = 0xFFFFu;
209 Index& operator = (uint16_t i) { HBUINT16::operator= (i); return *this; }
210};
211DECLARE_NULL_NAMESPACE_BYTES (OT, Index);
212
213typedef Index NameID;
214
215struct VarIdx : HBUINT32 {
216 static constexpr unsigned NO_VARIATION = 0xFFFFFFFFu;
217 static_assert (NO_VARIATION == HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_VARIATIONS_INDEX, "");
218 static uint32_t add (uint32_t i, unsigned short v)
219 {
220 if (i == NO_VARIATION) return i;
221 return i + v;
222 }
223 VarIdx& operator = (uint32_t i) { HBUINT32::operator= (i); return *this; }
224};
225DECLARE_NULL_NAMESPACE_BYTES (OT, VarIdx);
226
227/* Offset, Null offset = 0 */
228template <typename Type, bool has_null=true>
229struct Offset : Type
230{
231 Offset& operator = (typename Type::type i) { Type::operator= (i); return *this; }
232
233 typedef Type type;
234
235 bool is_null () const { return has_null && 0 == *this; }
236
237 public:
238 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (sizeof (Type));
239};
240
241typedef Offset<HBUINT16> Offset16;
242typedef Offset<HBUINT24> Offset24;
243typedef Offset<HBUINT32> Offset32;
244
245
246/* CheckSum */
247struct CheckSum : HBUINT32
248{
249 CheckSum& operator = (uint32_t i) { HBUINT32::operator= (i); return *this; }
250
251 /* This is reference implementation from the spec. */
252 static uint32_t CalcTableChecksum (const HBUINT32 *Table, uint32_t Length)
253 {
254 uint32_t Sum = 0L;
255 assert (0 == (Length & 3));
256 const HBUINT32 *EndPtr = Table + Length / HBUINT32::static_size;
257
258 while (Table < EndPtr)
259 Sum += *Table++;
260 return Sum;
261 }
262
263 /* Note: data should be 4byte aligned and have 4byte padding at the end. */
264 void set_for_data (const void *data, unsigned int length)
265 { *this = CalcTableChecksum (Table: (const HBUINT32 *) data, Length: length); }
266
267 public:
268 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (4);
269};
270
271
272/*
273 * Version Numbers
274 */
275
276template <typename FixedType=HBUINT16>
277struct FixedVersion
278{
279 uint32_t to_int () const { return (major << (sizeof (FixedType) * 8)) + minor; }
280
281 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
282 {
283 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
284 return_trace (c->check_struct (this));
285 }
286
287 FixedType major;
288 FixedType minor;
289 public:
290 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (2 * sizeof (FixedType));
291};
292
293
294/*
295 * Template subclasses of Offset that do the dereferencing.
296 * Use: (base+offset)
297 */
298
299template <typename Type, bool has_null>
300struct _hb_has_null
301{
302 static const Type *get_null () { return nullptr; }
303 static Type *get_crap () { return nullptr; }
304};
305template <typename Type>
306struct _hb_has_null<Type, true>
307{
308 static const Type *get_null () { return &Null (Type); }
309 static Type *get_crap () { return &Crap (Type); }
310};
311
312template <typename Type, typename OffsetType, bool has_null=true>
313struct OffsetTo : Offset<OffsetType, has_null>
314{
315 // Make sure Type is not unbounded; works only for types that are fully defined at OffsetTo time.
316 static_assert (has_null == false ||
317 (hb_has_null_size (Type) || !hb_has_min_size (Type)), "");
318
319 HB_DELETE_COPY_ASSIGN (OffsetTo);
320 OffsetTo () = default;
321
322 OffsetTo& operator = (typename OffsetType::type i) { OffsetType::operator= (i); return *this; }
323
324 const Type& operator () (const void *base) const
325 {
326 if (unlikely (this->is_null ())) return *_hb_has_null<Type, has_null>::get_null ();
327 return StructAtOffset<const Type> (base, *this);
328 }
329 Type& operator () (void *base) const
330 {
331 if (unlikely (this->is_null ())) return *_hb_has_null<Type, has_null>::get_crap ();
332 return StructAtOffset<Type> (base, *this);
333 }
334
335 template <typename Base,
336 hb_enable_if (hb_is_convertible (const Base, const void *))>
337 friend const Type& operator + (const Base &base, const OffsetTo &offset) { return offset ((const void *) base); }
338 template <typename Base,
339 hb_enable_if (hb_is_convertible (const Base, const void *))>
340 friend const Type& operator + (const OffsetTo &offset, const Base &base) { return offset ((const void *) base); }
341 template <typename Base,
342 hb_enable_if (hb_is_convertible (Base, void *))>
343 friend Type& operator + (Base &&base, OffsetTo &offset) { return offset ((void *) base); }
344 template <typename Base,
345 hb_enable_if (hb_is_convertible (Base, void *))>
346 friend Type& operator + (OffsetTo &offset, Base &&base) { return offset ((void *) base); }
347
348
349 template <typename ...Ts>
350 bool serialize_subset (hb_subset_context_t *c, const OffsetTo& src,
351 const void *src_base, Ts&&... ds)
352 {
353 *this = 0;
354 if (src.is_null ())
355 return false;
356
357 auto *s = c->serializer;
358
359 s->push ();
360
361 bool ret = c->dispatch (src_base+src, std::forward<Ts> (ds)...);
362
363 if (ret || !has_null)
364 s->add_link (*this, s->pop_pack ());
365 else
366 s->pop_discard ();
367
368 return ret;
369 }
370
371
372 template <typename ...Ts>
373 bool serialize_serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, Ts&&... ds)
374 {
375 *this = 0;
376
377 Type* obj = c->push<Type> ();
378 bool ret = obj->serialize (c, std::forward<Ts> (ds)...);
379
380 if (ret)
381 c->add_link (*this, c->pop_pack ());
382 else
383 c->pop_discard ();
384
385 return ret;
386 }
387
388 /* TODO: Somehow merge this with previous function into a serialize_dispatch(). */
389 /* Workaround clang bug: https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=23029
390 * Can't compile: whence = hb_serialize_context_t::Head followed by Ts&&...
391 */
392 template <typename ...Ts>
393 bool serialize_copy (hb_serialize_context_t *c, const OffsetTo& src,
394 const void *src_base, unsigned dst_bias,
395 hb_serialize_context_t::whence_t whence,
396 Ts&&... ds)
397 {
398 *this = 0;
399 if (src.is_null ())
400 return false;
401
402 c->push ();
403
404 bool ret = c->copy (src_base+src, std::forward<Ts> (ds)...);
405
406 c->add_link (*this, c->pop_pack (), whence, dst_bias);
407
408 return ret;
409 }
410
411 bool serialize_copy (hb_serialize_context_t *c, const OffsetTo& src,
412 const void *src_base, unsigned dst_bias = 0)
413 { return serialize_copy (c, src, src_base, dst_bias, hb_serialize_context_t::Head); }
414
415 bool sanitize_shallow (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, const void *base) const
416 {
417 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
418 if (unlikely (!c->check_struct (this))) return_trace (false);
419 if (unlikely (this->is_null ())) return_trace (true);
420 if (unlikely ((const char *) base + (unsigned) *this < (const char *) base)) return_trace (false);
421 return_trace (true);
422 }
423
424 template <typename ...Ts>
425 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, const void *base, Ts&&... ds) const
426 {
427 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
428 return_trace (sanitize_shallow (c, base) &&
429 (this->is_null () ||
430 c->dispatch (StructAtOffset<Type> (base, *this), std::forward<Ts> (ds)...) ||
431 neuter (c)));
432 }
433
434 /* Set the offset to Null */
435 bool neuter (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
436 {
437 if (!has_null) return false;
438 return c->try_set (this, 0);
439 }
440 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (sizeof (OffsetType));
441};
442/* Partial specializations. */
443template <typename Type, bool has_null=true> using Offset16To = OffsetTo<Type, HBUINT16, has_null>;
444template <typename Type, bool has_null=true> using Offset24To = OffsetTo<Type, HBUINT24, has_null>;
445template <typename Type, bool has_null=true> using Offset32To = OffsetTo<Type, HBUINT32, has_null>;
446
447template <typename Type, typename OffsetType> using NNOffsetTo = OffsetTo<Type, OffsetType, false>;
448template <typename Type> using NNOffset16To = Offset16To<Type, false>;
449template <typename Type> using NNOffset24To = Offset24To<Type, false>;
450template <typename Type> using NNOffset32To = Offset32To<Type, false>;
451
452
453/*
454 * Array Types
455 */
456
457template <typename Type>
458struct UnsizedArrayOf
459{
460 typedef Type item_t;
461 static constexpr unsigned item_size = hb_static_size (Type);
462
463 HB_DELETE_CREATE_COPY_ASSIGN (UnsizedArrayOf);
464
465 const Type& operator [] (int i_) const
466 {
467 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
468 const Type *p = &arrayZ[i];
469 if (unlikely ((const void *) p < (const void *) arrayZ)) return Null (Type); /* Overflowed. */
470 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
471 return *p;
472 }
473 Type& operator [] (int i_)
474 {
475 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
476 Type *p = &arrayZ[i];
477 if (unlikely ((const void *) p < (const void *) arrayZ)) return Crap (Type); /* Overflowed. */
478 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
479 return *p;
480 }
481
482 unsigned int get_size (unsigned int len) const
483 { return len * Type::static_size; }
484
485 template <typename T> operator T * () { return arrayZ; }
486 template <typename T> operator const T * () const { return arrayZ; }
487 hb_array_t<Type> as_array (unsigned int len)
488 { return hb_array (arrayZ, len); }
489 hb_array_t<const Type> as_array (unsigned int len) const
490 { return hb_array (arrayZ, len); }
491
492 template <typename T>
493 Type &lsearch (unsigned int len, const T &x, Type &not_found = Crap (Type))
494 { return *as_array (len).lsearch (x, &not_found); }
495 template <typename T>
496 const Type &lsearch (unsigned int len, const T &x, const Type &not_found = Null (Type)) const
497 { return *as_array (len).lsearch (x, &not_found); }
498 template <typename T>
499 bool lfind (unsigned int len, const T &x, unsigned int *i = nullptr,
500 hb_not_found_t not_found = HB_NOT_FOUND_DONT_STORE,
501 unsigned int to_store = (unsigned int) -1) const
502 { return as_array (len).lfind (x, i, not_found, to_store); }
503
504 void qsort (unsigned int len, unsigned int start = 0, unsigned int end = (unsigned int) -1)
505 { as_array (len).qsort (start, end); }
506
507 bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, unsigned int items_len, bool clear = true)
508 {
509 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
510 if (unlikely (!c->extend_size (this, get_size (items_len), clear))) return_trace (false);
511 return_trace (true);
512 }
513 template <typename Iterator,
514 hb_requires (hb_is_source_of (Iterator, Type))>
515 bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, Iterator items)
516 {
517 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
518 unsigned count = hb_len (items);
519 if (unlikely (!serialize (c, count, false))) return_trace (false);
520 /* TODO Umm. Just exhaust the iterator instead? Being extra
521 * cautious right now.. */
522 for (unsigned i = 0; i < count; i++, ++items)
523 arrayZ[i] = *items;
524 return_trace (true);
525 }
526
527 UnsizedArrayOf* copy (hb_serialize_context_t *c, unsigned count) const
528 {
529 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
530 auto *out = c->start_embed (this);
531 if (unlikely (!as_array (count).copy (c))) return_trace (nullptr);
532 return_trace (out);
533 }
534
535 template <typename ...Ts>
536 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, unsigned int count, Ts&&... ds) const
537 {
538 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
539 if (unlikely (!sanitize_shallow (c, count))) return_trace (false);
540 if (!sizeof... (Ts) && hb_is_trivially_copyable(Type)) return_trace (true);
541 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
542 if (unlikely (!c->dispatch (arrayZ[i], std::forward<Ts> (ds)...)))
543 return_trace (false);
544 return_trace (true);
545 }
546
547 bool sanitize_shallow (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, unsigned int count) const
548 {
549 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
550 return_trace (c->check_array (arrayZ, count));
551 }
552
553 public:
554 Type arrayZ[HB_VAR_ARRAY];
555 public:
556 DEFINE_SIZE_UNBOUNDED (0);
557};
558
559/* Unsized array of offset's */
560template <typename Type, typename OffsetType, bool has_null=true>
561using UnsizedArray16OfOffsetTo = UnsizedArrayOf<OffsetTo<Type, OffsetType, has_null>>;
562
563/* Unsized array of offsets relative to the beginning of the array itself. */
564template <typename Type, typename OffsetType, bool has_null=true>
565struct UnsizedListOfOffset16To : UnsizedArray16OfOffsetTo<Type, OffsetType, has_null>
566{
567 const Type& operator [] (int i_) const
568 {
569 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
570 const OffsetTo<Type, OffsetType, has_null> *p = &this->arrayZ[i];
571 if (unlikely ((const void *) p < (const void *) this->arrayZ)) return Null (Type); /* Overflowed. */
572 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
573 return this+*p;
574 }
575 Type& operator [] (int i_)
576 {
577 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
578 const OffsetTo<Type, OffsetType, has_null> *p = &this->arrayZ[i];
579 if (unlikely ((const void *) p < (const void *) this->arrayZ)) return Crap (Type); /* Overflowed. */
580 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
581 return this+*p;
582 }
583
584 template <typename ...Ts>
585 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, unsigned int count, Ts&&... ds) const
586 {
587 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
588 return_trace ((UnsizedArray16OfOffsetTo<Type, OffsetType, has_null>
589 ::sanitize (c, count, this, std::forward<Ts> (ds)...)));
590 }
591};
592
593/* An array with sorted elements. Supports binary searching. */
594template <typename Type>
595struct SortedUnsizedArrayOf : UnsizedArrayOf<Type>
596{
597 hb_sorted_array_t<Type> as_array (unsigned int len)
598 { return hb_sorted_array (this->arrayZ, len); }
599 hb_sorted_array_t<const Type> as_array (unsigned int len) const
600 { return hb_sorted_array (this->arrayZ, len); }
601 operator hb_sorted_array_t<Type> () { return as_array (); }
602 operator hb_sorted_array_t<const Type> () const { return as_array (); }
603
604 template <typename T>
605 Type &bsearch (unsigned int len, const T &x, Type &not_found = Crap (Type))
606 { return *as_array (len).bsearch (x, &not_found); }
607 template <typename T>
608 const Type &bsearch (unsigned int len, const T &x, const Type &not_found = Null (Type)) const
609 { return *as_array (len).bsearch (x, &not_found); }
610 template <typename T>
611 bool bfind (unsigned int len, const T &x, unsigned int *i = nullptr,
612 hb_not_found_t not_found = HB_NOT_FOUND_DONT_STORE,
613 unsigned int to_store = (unsigned int) -1) const
614 { return as_array (len).bfind (x, i, not_found, to_store); }
615};
616
617
618/* An array with a number of elements. */
619template <typename Type, typename LenType>
620struct ArrayOf
621{
622 typedef Type item_t;
623 static constexpr unsigned item_size = hb_static_size (Type);
624
625 HB_DELETE_CREATE_COPY_ASSIGN (ArrayOf);
626
627 const Type& operator [] (int i_) const
628 {
629 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
630 if (unlikely (i >= len)) return Null (Type);
631 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
632 return arrayZ[i];
633 }
634 Type& operator [] (int i_)
635 {
636 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
637 if (unlikely (i >= len)) return Crap (Type);
638 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
639 return arrayZ[i];
640 }
641
642 unsigned int get_size () const
643 { return len.static_size + len * Type::static_size; }
644
645 explicit operator bool () const { return len; }
646
647 void pop () { len--; }
648
649 hb_array_t< Type> as_array () { return hb_array (arrayZ, len); }
650 hb_array_t<const Type> as_array () const { return hb_array (arrayZ, len); }
651
652 /* Iterator. */
653 typedef hb_array_t<const Type> iter_t;
654 typedef hb_array_t< Type> writer_t;
655 iter_t iter () const { return as_array (); }
656 writer_t writer () { return as_array (); }
657 operator iter_t () const { return iter (); }
658 operator writer_t () { return writer (); }
659
660 /* Faster range-based for loop. */
661 const Type *begin () const { return arrayZ; }
662 const Type *end () const { return arrayZ + len; }
663
664 template <typename T>
665 Type &lsearch (const T &x, Type &not_found = Crap (Type))
666 { return *as_array ().lsearch (x, &not_found); }
667 template <typename T>
668 const Type &lsearch (const T &x, const Type &not_found = Null (Type)) const
669 { return *as_array ().lsearch (x, &not_found); }
670 template <typename T>
671 bool lfind (const T &x, unsigned int *i = nullptr,
672 hb_not_found_t not_found = HB_NOT_FOUND_DONT_STORE,
673 unsigned int to_store = (unsigned int) -1) const
674 { return as_array ().lfind (x, i, not_found, to_store); }
675
676 void qsort ()
677 { as_array ().qsort (); }
678
679 HB_NODISCARD bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, unsigned items_len, bool clear = true)
680 {
681 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
682 if (unlikely (!c->extend_min (this))) return_trace (false);
683 c->check_assign (len, items_len, HB_SERIALIZE_ERROR_ARRAY_OVERFLOW);
684 if (unlikely (!c->extend_size (this, get_size (), clear))) return_trace (false);
685 return_trace (true);
686 }
687 template <typename Iterator,
688 hb_requires (hb_is_source_of (Iterator, Type))>
689 HB_NODISCARD bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, Iterator items)
690 {
691 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
692 unsigned count = hb_len (items);
693 if (unlikely (!serialize (c, count, false))) return_trace (false);
694 /* TODO Umm. Just exhaust the iterator instead? Being extra
695 * cautious right now.. */
696 for (unsigned i = 0; i < count; i++, ++items)
697 arrayZ[i] = *items;
698 return_trace (true);
699 }
700
701 Type* serialize_append (hb_serialize_context_t *c)
702 {
703 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
704 len++;
705 if (unlikely (!len || !c->extend (this)))
706 {
707 len--;
708 return_trace (nullptr);
709 }
710 return_trace (&arrayZ[len - 1]);
711 }
712
713 ArrayOf* copy (hb_serialize_context_t *c) const
714 {
715 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
716 auto *out = c->start_embed (this);
717 if (unlikely (!c->extend_min (out))) return_trace (nullptr);
718 c->check_assign (out->len, len, HB_SERIALIZE_ERROR_ARRAY_OVERFLOW);
719 if (unlikely (!as_array ().copy (c))) return_trace (nullptr);
720 return_trace (out);
721 }
722
723 template <typename ...Ts>
724 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, Ts&&... ds) const
725 {
726 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
727 if (unlikely (!sanitize_shallow (c))) return_trace (false);
728 if (!sizeof... (Ts) && hb_is_trivially_copyable(Type)) return_trace (true);
729 unsigned int count = len;
730 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
731 if (unlikely (!c->dispatch (arrayZ[i], std::forward<Ts> (ds)...)))
732 return_trace (false);
733 return_trace (true);
734 }
735
736 bool sanitize_shallow (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
737 {
738 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
739 return_trace (len.sanitize (c) && c->check_array (arrayZ, len));
740 }
741
742 public:
743 LenType len;
744 Type arrayZ[HB_VAR_ARRAY];
745 public:
746 DEFINE_SIZE_ARRAY (sizeof (LenType), arrayZ);
747};
748template <typename Type> using Array16Of = ArrayOf<Type, HBUINT16>;
749template <typename Type> using Array24Of = ArrayOf<Type, HBUINT24>;
750template <typename Type> using Array32Of = ArrayOf<Type, HBUINT32>;
751using PString = ArrayOf<HBUINT8, HBUINT8>;

753/* Array of Offset's */
754template <typename Type> using Array16OfOffset16To = ArrayOf<OffsetTo<Type, HBUINT16>, HBUINT16>;
755template <typename Type> using Array16OfOffset32To = ArrayOf<OffsetTo<Type, HBUINT32>, HBUINT16>;
756template <typename Type> using Array32OfOffset32To = ArrayOf<OffsetTo<Type, HBUINT32>, HBUINT32>;
757
758/* Array of offsets relative to the beginning of the array itself. */
759template <typename Type, typename OffsetType>
760struct List16OfOffsetTo : ArrayOf<OffsetTo<Type, OffsetType>, HBUINT16>
761{
762 const Type& operator [] (int i_) const
763 {
764 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
765 if (unlikely (i >= this->len)) return Null (Type);
766 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
767 return this+this->arrayZ[i];
768 }
769 const Type& operator [] (int i_)
770 {
771 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
772 if (unlikely (i >= this->len)) return Crap (Type);
773 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
774 return this+this->arrayZ[i];
775 }
776
777 bool subset (hb_subset_context_t *c) const
778 {
779 TRACE_SUBSET (this);
780 struct List16OfOffsetTo *out = c->serializer->embed (*this);
781 if (unlikely (!out)) return_trace (false);
782 unsigned int count = this->len;
783 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
784 out->arrayZ[i].serialize_subset (c, this->arrayZ[i], this, out);
785 return_trace (true);
786 }
787
788 template <typename ...Ts>
789 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, Ts&&... ds) const
790 {
791 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
792 return_trace ((Array16Of<OffsetTo<Type, OffsetType>>::sanitize (c, this, std::forward<Ts> (ds)...)));
793 }
794};
795
796template <typename Type>
797using List16OfOffset16To = List16OfOffsetTo<Type, HBUINT16>;

799/* An array starting at second element. */
800template <typename Type, typename LenType=HBUINT16>
801struct HeadlessArrayOf
802{
803 static constexpr unsigned item_size = Type::static_size;
804
805 HB_DELETE_CREATE_COPY_ASSIGN (HeadlessArrayOf);
806
807 const Type& operator [] (int i_) const
808 {
809 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
810 if (unlikely (i >= lenP1 || !i)) return Null (Type);
811 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
812 return arrayZ[i-1];
813 }
814 Type& operator [] (int i_)
815 {
816 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
817 if (unlikely (i >= lenP1 || !i)) return Crap (Type);
818 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
819 return arrayZ[i-1];
820 }
821 unsigned int get_size () const
822 { return lenP1.static_size + get_length () * Type::static_size; }
823
824 unsigned get_length () const { return lenP1 ? lenP1 - 1 : 0; }
825
826 hb_array_t< Type> as_array () { return hb_array (arrayZ, get_length ()); }
827 hb_array_t<const Type> as_array () const { return hb_array (arrayZ, get_length ()); }
828
829 /* Iterator. */
830 typedef hb_array_t<const Type> iter_t;
831 typedef hb_array_t< Type> writer_t;
832 iter_t iter () const { return as_array (); }
833 writer_t writer () { return as_array (); }
834 operator iter_t () const { return iter (); }
835 operator writer_t () { return writer (); }
836
837 /* Faster range-based for loop. */
838 const Type *begin () const { return arrayZ; }
839 const Type *end () const { return arrayZ + get_length (); }
840
841 HB_NODISCARD bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, unsigned int items_len, bool clear = true)
842 {
843 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
844 if (unlikely (!c->extend_min (this))) return_trace (false);
845 c->check_assign (lenP1, items_len + 1, HB_SERIALIZE_ERROR_ARRAY_OVERFLOW);
846 if (unlikely (!c->extend_size (this, get_size (), clear))) return_trace (false);
847 return_trace (true);
848 }
849 template <typename Iterator,
850 hb_requires (hb_is_source_of (Iterator, Type))>
851 HB_NODISCARD bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, Iterator items)
852 {
853 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
854 unsigned count = hb_len (items);
855 if (unlikely (!serialize (c, count, false))) return_trace (false);
856 /* TODO Umm. Just exhaust the iterator instead? Being extra
857 * cautious right now.. */
858 for (unsigned i = 0; i < count; i++, ++items)
859 arrayZ[i] = *items;
860 return_trace (true);
861 }
862
863 template <typename ...Ts>
864 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, Ts&&... ds) const
865 {
866 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
867 if (unlikely (!sanitize_shallow (c))) return_trace (false);
868 if (!sizeof... (Ts) && hb_is_trivially_copyable(Type)) return_trace (true);
869 unsigned int count = get_length ();
870 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
871 if (unlikely (!c->dispatch (arrayZ[i], std::forward<Ts> (ds)...)))
872 return_trace (false);
873 return_trace (true);
874 }
875
876 private:
877 bool sanitize_shallow (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
878 {
879 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
880 return_trace (lenP1.sanitize (c) &&
881 (!lenP1 || c->check_array (arrayZ, lenP1 - 1)));
882 }
883
884 public:
885 LenType lenP1;
886 Type arrayZ[HB_VAR_ARRAY];
887 public:
888 DEFINE_SIZE_ARRAY (sizeof (LenType), arrayZ);
889};

891/* An array storing length-1. */
892template <typename Type, typename LenType=HBUINT16>
893struct ArrayOfM1
894{
895 HB_DELETE_CREATE_COPY_ASSIGN (ArrayOfM1);
896
897 const Type& operator [] (int i_) const
898 {
899 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
900 if (unlikely (i > lenM1)) return Null (Type);
901 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
902 return arrayZ[i];
903 }
904 Type& operator [] (int i_)
905 {
906 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
907 if (unlikely (i > lenM1)) return Crap (Type);
908 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
909 return arrayZ[i];
910 }
911 unsigned int get_size () const
912 { return lenM1.static_size + (lenM1 + 1) * Type::static_size; }
913
914 template <typename ...Ts>
915 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, Ts&&... ds) const
916 {
917 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
918 if (unlikely (!sanitize_shallow (c))) return_trace (false);
919 if (!sizeof... (Ts) && hb_is_trivially_copyable(Type)) return_trace (true);
920 unsigned int count = lenM1 + 1;
921 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
922 if (unlikely (!c->dispatch (arrayZ[i], std::forward<Ts> (ds)...)))
923 return_trace (false);
924 return_trace (true);
925 }
926
927 private:
928 bool sanitize_shallow (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
929 {
930 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
931 return_trace (lenM1.sanitize (c) &&
932 (c->check_array (arrayZ, lenM1 + 1)));
933 }
934
935 public:
936 LenType lenM1;
937 Type arrayZ[HB_VAR_ARRAY];
938 public:
939 DEFINE_SIZE_ARRAY (sizeof (LenType), arrayZ);
940};

942/* An array with sorted elements. Supports binary searching. */
943template <typename Type, typename LenType>
944struct SortedArrayOf : ArrayOf<Type, LenType>
945{
946 hb_sorted_array_t< Type> as_array () { return hb_sorted_array (this->arrayZ, this->len); }
947 hb_sorted_array_t<const Type> as_array () const { return hb_sorted_array (this->arrayZ, this->len); }
948
949 /* Iterator. */
950 typedef hb_sorted_array_t<const Type> iter_t;
951 typedef hb_sorted_array_t< Type> writer_t;
952 iter_t iter () const { return as_array (); }
953 writer_t writer () { return as_array (); }
954 operator iter_t () const { return iter (); }
955 operator writer_t () { return writer (); }
956
957 /* Faster range-based for loop. */
958 const Type *begin () const { return this->arrayZ; }
959 const Type *end () const { return this->arrayZ + this->len; }
960
961 bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, unsigned int items_len)
962 {
963 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
964 bool ret = ArrayOf<Type, LenType>::serialize (c, items_len);
965 return_trace (ret);
966 }
967 template <typename Iterator,
968 hb_requires (hb_is_sorted_source_of (Iterator, Type))>
969 bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, Iterator items)
970 {
971 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
972 bool ret = ArrayOf<Type, LenType>::serialize (c, items);
973 return_trace (ret);
974 }
975
976 template <typename T>
977 Type &bsearch (const T &x, Type &not_found = Crap (Type))
978 { return *as_array ().bsearch (x, &not_found); }
979 template <typename T>
980 const Type &bsearch (const T &x, const Type &not_found = Null (Type)) const
981 { return *as_array ().bsearch (x, &not_found); }

984 hb_not_found_t not_found = HB_NOT_FOUND_DONT_STORE,

986 { return as_array ().bfind (x, i, not_found, to_store); }
987};

989template <typename Type> using SortedArray16Of = SortedArrayOf<Type, HBUINT16>;

993/*
994 * Binary-search arrays
995 */
996
997template <typename LenType=HBUINT16>
998struct BinSearchHeader
999{
1000 operator uint32_t () const { return len; }
1001
1002 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
1003 {
1004 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
1005 return_trace (c->check_struct (this));
1006 }
1007
1008 BinSearchHeader& operator = (unsigned int v)
1009 {
1010 len = v;
1011 assert (len == v);
1012 entrySelector = hb_max (1u, hb_bit_storage (v)) - 1;
1013 searchRange = 16 * (1u << entrySelector);
1014 rangeShift = v * 16 > searchRange
1015 ? 16 * v - searchRange
1016 : 0;
1017 return *this;
1018 }
1019
1020 protected:
1021 LenType len;
1022 LenType searchRange;
1023 LenType entrySelector;
1024 LenType rangeShift;
1025
1026 public:
1027 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (8);
1028};
1029
1030template <typename Type, typename LenType=HBUINT16>
1031using BinSearchArrayOf = SortedArrayOf<Type, BinSearchHeader<LenType>>;
1032
1033
1034struct VarSizedBinSearchHeader
1035{
1036
1037 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
1038 {
1039 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
1040 return_trace (c->check_struct (this));
1041 }
1042
1043 HBUINT16 unitSize; /* Size of a lookup unit for this search in bytes. */
1044 HBUINT16 nUnits; /* Number of units of the preceding size to be searched. */
1045 HBUINT16 searchRange; /* The value of unitSize times the largest power of 2
1046 * that is less than or equal to the value of nUnits. */
1047 HBUINT16 entrySelector; /* The log base 2 of the largest power of 2 less than
1048 * or equal to the value of nUnits. */
1049 HBUINT16 rangeShift; /* The value of unitSize times the difference of the
1050 * value of nUnits minus the largest power of 2 less
1051 * than or equal to the value of nUnits. */
1052 public:
1053 DEFINE_SIZE_STATIC (10);
1054};
1055
1056template <typename Type>
1057struct VarSizedBinSearchArrayOf
1058{
1059 static constexpr unsigned item_size = Type::static_size;
1060
1061 HB_DELETE_CREATE_COPY_ASSIGN (VarSizedBinSearchArrayOf);
1062
1063 bool last_is_terminator () const
1064 {
1065 if (unlikely (!header.nUnits)) return false;
1066
1067 /* Gah.
1068 *
1069 * "The number of termination values that need to be included is table-specific.
1070 * The value that indicates binary search termination is 0xFFFF." */
1071 const HBUINT16 *words = &StructAtOffset<HBUINT16> (P: &bytesZ, offset: (header.nUnits - 1) * header.unitSize);
1072 unsigned int count = Type::TerminationWordCount;
1073 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
1074 if (words[i] != 0xFFFFu)
1075 return false;
1076 return true;
1077 }
1078
1079 const Type& operator [] (int i_) const
1080 {
1081 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
1082 if (unlikely (i >= get_length ())) return Null (Type);
1083 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
1084 return StructAtOffset<Type> (&bytesZ, i * header.unitSize);
1085 }
1086 Type& operator [] (int i_)
1087 {
1088 unsigned int i = (unsigned int) i_;
1089 if (unlikely (i >= get_length ())) return Crap (Type);
1090 _hb_compiler_memory_r_barrier ();
1091 return StructAtOffset<Type> (&bytesZ, i * header.unitSize);
1092 }
1093 unsigned int get_length () const
1094 { return header.nUnits - last_is_terminator (); }
1095 unsigned int get_size () const
1096 { return header.static_size + header.nUnits * header.unitSize; }
1097
1098 template <typename ...Ts>
1099 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c, Ts&&... ds) const
1100 {
1101 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
1102 if (unlikely (!sanitize_shallow (c))) return_trace (false);
1103 if (!sizeof... (Ts) && hb_is_trivially_copyable(Type)) return_trace (true);
1104 unsigned int count = get_length ();
1105 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
1106 if (unlikely (!(*this)[i].sanitize (c, std::forward<Ts> (ds)...)))
1107 return_trace (false);
1108 return_trace (true);
1109 }
1110
1111 template <typename T>
1112 const Type *bsearch (const T &key) const
1113 {
1114 unsigned pos;
1115 return hb_bsearch_impl (&pos,
1116 key,
1117 (const void *) bytesZ,
1118 get_length (),
1119 header.unitSize,
1120 _hb_cmp_method<T, Type>)
1121 ? (const Type *) (((const char *) &bytesZ) + (pos * header.unitSize))
1122 : nullptr;
1123 }
1124
1125 private:
1126 bool sanitize_shallow (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
1127 {
1128 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
1129 return_trace (header.sanitize (c) &&
1130 Type::static_size <= header.unitSize &&
1131 c->check_range (bytesZ.arrayZ,
1132 header.nUnits,
1133 header.unitSize));
1134 }
1135
1136 protected:
1137 VarSizedBinSearchHeader header;
1138 UnsizedArrayOf<HBUINT8> bytesZ;
1139 public:
1140 DEFINE_SIZE_ARRAY (10, bytesZ);
1141};
